description.p: You utter a word of pure anguish, condemning a creature within range to experience excruciating pain. Choose one of the following effects when you cast this spell:

Torment the Flesh.
The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12d6 necrotic damage, falls prone, and has its speed reduced to 0. In addition, the target suffers a cumulative -1 penalty to Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws rolls for each 6 rolled on the damage dice.

Torment the Mind.
The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12d6 psychic damage, falls prone, and has its speed reduced to 0. In addition, the target suffers a cumulative -1 penalty to Intelligence and Charisma ability checks, saving throws, and concentration saving throws for each 6 rolled on the damage dice.
The effect of this spell last until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

A Taste of Suffering.
Whenever you roll a 6 on a damage die for this spell, you may re-roll one other damage die that is not a 6. If you ever roll a 6 on all 12 damage dice, the final damage dealt is multiplied by 6.

You point your finger to a creature to siphon its life force. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, target takes 1d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.
The spell's damage increases by 1d6 at 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
